name: places/ChIJ07cQkYP3wokRPQ1CHprtsgE
formattedAddress: 316 W 97th St, New York, NY 10025, USA
adrFormatAddress: 316 W 97th St, New York, NY 10025, USA

originalText.text:
Echoing a very similar story to Samantha, Brandon, and Dan in the reviews below.  Wish I'd read them before proceeding!  Frank talks the talk and then delivers a sloppy, unfinished job that he says he'll come back and fix and/or complete...until he never does.  In my case, it was messy retiling and regrouting alongside a floor that was to be sealed per the terms of our contract.  Frank sloppily finished about 2/3 of the work he'd signed off on and then bailed when he and his handyman convinced me to fork over the balance somehow.  False promises to return via email for about a month and a half and then the line went dead.

Frank if you're reading this review, know that I'm happy to adjust it once the contracted work is finished to spec.  Until then, prospective clients should know what to expect.

originalText.text:
Frank is a scam artist. After regrouting our bathroom, he touched up the grout with a DIFFERENT COLOR grout than he originally used, so random spots have darker grout. There are gaps in our grout which we didn't have before he regrouted, and they were never filled in. He damaged our toilet seat, when he was not even doing work to our toilet. He left clumps of grout in places that were not cleaned, he clogged our sink & tub drains with grout, and left our apartment a complete mess.

Not only is his work poor, but so is his work ethic. He had estimated the work in our bathroom would take 1 day. Instead, he spent 4 days working, only for us to wind up with what was still a completely terrible, unprofessional job. He was often hours late with no communication. When we expressed our dissatisfaction with the work done, he came up with multiple excuses -- he wasn't feeling well, he was supposed to have a different technician helping him, our walls were tough, etc. None of those are excuses for why the grout was touched up with a different color... and if he wasn't feeling well or didn't have proper help than he should have rescheduled.

I think the pictures speak for themselves. This is just a small sample of what his finished product looked like after 4 days of work. We asked for a partial refund and he ghosted us. Do not work with him. He talks like he knows what he's doing and then this is the work he leaves you with.

originalText.text:
We had a truly bewildering experience with Frank; he was able to "talk the talk" but delivered a stunningly poor job that cost thousands to repair. Despite only being tasked with repairing a towel bar, Frank managed to damage every surface, fixture, and finish in our bathroom: our faucet was scuffed, our shower door covered in caulk, our paneling was stained, our tiles left protruding by a centimeter or more -- even the towel bar itself was scratched and bent.

There is no getting in touch with Frank once he destroys your property. The moment he's paid, he's gone. Avoid at all costs.

originalText.text: Frank is a true craftsman and a consummate professional.  He takes great pride in his work and is a perfectionist.  He and his apprentice, Chris, worked so hard, didn't waste a minute of their day, and I feel fortunate to have had them work in my kitchen and bathroom.  The grout and caulk work is superb.

text.text: Frank is a true craftsman and a consummate professional.  He takes great pride in his work and is a perfectionist.  He and his apprentice, Chris, worked so hard, didn't waste a minute of their day, and I feel fortunate to have had them work in my kitchen and bathroom.  The grout and caulk work is superb.

originalText.text: Frank is an absolute joke. He requests for a deposit only to find out that he doesn't complete the job. There are days that he doesn't show up or he doesn't even respond to calls or texts respectfully. When he does return your text, he responds with threatening messages, stating "you expect too much for a replacement job" and his overall work ethic is so unprofessional. He doesn't respect you as a person, thinks he is above the law, and worse of all, he doesn't care about how we think the project should come out or about his overall horrendous work job that he doesn't commit to finish. We simply asked him to replace a tile back on the wall, yet he replaces the tile on an angle and refuses to make it look clean and even. He continues to make excuses that the wall is already uneven and can't be replaced evenly, yet that is so untrue as the original tile was on evenly and clean. We even requested a partial refund for this horrendous work job, instead demands extra money for the time he spent on it. Of course, the money was never refunded and never replies back to issues that need to be addressed right away. I just cannot believe the 5-star reviews that this man receives from his professionalism that he represents. Its a far outcry and a scam. Neighbors, please be aware of the Groutman because he is a scam artist.
